course.title: Christian Ethics and Modern Society
course.meeting_text: Th., 2–4 and an hour to be arranged
course.description: This course provides an introduction to Christian conceptions of conduct, character, and community, as well as modern disputes over their interpretation and application. How are Christian principles related to modern ideals of freedom, equality, and democracy? What do Christian principles imply for contemporary issues related to religious pluralism, secularism, feminism, racism, and globalization? Readings will provide historical background and highlight a variety of contemporary perspectives and approaches to Christian ethics. Special emphasis will be given to current moral and political challenges, including war and peace, the environment, capitalism and consumption, abortion and euthanasia, and love, sexuality, and marriage.
